column4: hi, most pdf ebooks around have menus and they have real text instead of text in images. How do people do them? Some kind of OCR software? I heard OCR often causes formatting problems and errors, but these books don't seem to have any problems at all. Can this be done in ubuntu? Thanks
maybe they're just released as PDF from the publisher?

maybe... I just got the impression that there are even old or rare books that are well formatted, which probably don't even exist as pdf for sale. I don't know... But if that's true, then I guess a good OCR software is the only way to go
well, open-source OCR software around is not especially good
